#Text=Poet , lyricist , and digital activist John Perry Barlow dies , aged 70
#Text=Friday , February 9 , 2018
#Text=On Wednesday morning , US poet , lyricist , and digital rights activist John Perry Barlow died in his sleep at his San Francisco home .
#Text=The announcement of his death specified no cause , but reportedly Barlow had recently experienced debilitating health problems .
#Text=The co-founder of the digital rights legal defense non-profit Electronic Frontier Foundation ( EFF ) and former lyricist of rock band Grateful Dead was 70 .
#Text=The EFF announced his death .
#Text=John Perry Barlow , 2009 .
#Text=Image : Joi .
#Text=( Reuseterms . )
#Text=Barlow composed lyrics for the Grateful Dead , several songs for the psychedelic rock band over almost 25years .
#Text=In the 1990s , he shifted his focus to the Internet , composing essays on Internet culture and working with the EFF to protect digital rights .
#Text=Born to Republican state legislator Norman Barlow and his wife Miriam , Barlow was raised on the Bar Cross Ranch in Pinedale , Wyoming .
#Text=Barlow became friends with future Grateful Dead guitarist Bob Weir in high school before attending Wesleyan University in Middleton , Connecticut , where he studied comparative religion .
#Text=During his studies , Barlow began visiting LSD ( lysergic acid diethylamide ) drug advocate Timothy Leary .
#Text=After graduation in 1969 , he opted to travel the world and returned to his family 's ranch in 1971 .
#Text=With his father ill from a stroke , the younger Barlow began ranching before Weir contacted him to finish songs for the latter 's solo album Ace .
#Text=The collaboration continued with the Grateful Dead and their individual members , with Barlow contributing occasional lyrics until the band 's 1995 dissolution .
#Text=In 1977 , he married Elaine Parker .
#Text=He sold the family ranch in 1988 due to financial strain .
#Text=Barlow became interested in the online world in the 1980s , including becoming a leader at on-line forum the WELL .
#Text=In 1990 , Barlow was interrogated by an Federal Bureau of Investigation agent about possible connections to underground hackers .
#Text=He posted his experience to the WELL and discovered that Mitch Kapor had had a similar encounter .

#Text=The duo decided to join together to help provide legal defense for the hackers and formally incorporated the EFF , adding to the EFF board Stewart Brand , John Gilmore , and Apple Inc. co-founder Steve Wozniak .
#Text=He served on the board of the EFF until his death .
#Text=He and Elaine divorced in 1995 .
#Text=He met Cynthia Horner in 1993 and was briefly engaged to her before her unexpected death from an undiagnosed health condition at the age of 29 .

#Text=In addition to digital activism , Barlow was an early commentator on Internet culture , writing several pieces for Wired in its early years and penning essays such as " A Declaration of the Independence of Cyberspace " ( 1996 ) that helped define digital citizenship .

column1: #Text=In 1998 he became a fellow of Harvard University ' s Berkman Klein Center for Internet and Society and in 2013 he was inducted into the Internet Hall of Fame .
#Text=Barlow stayed active in issues related to civil liberties and rights , helping to create the Freedom of the Press Foundation in 2012 .
#Text=Although he had mostly retired from songwriting , he contributed to several songs by jam band The String Cheese Incident .
#Text=Barlow suffered a major heart attack in 2015 .
#Text=By late 2016 , he faced several serious health conditions , leading several musicians to hold a benefit concert for him to raise funds for his medical bills .
#Text=He recently completed his memoir Mother American Night , slated for release on June 5 .
#Text=Barlow is survived by his ex-wife Elaine Parker Barlow ; the couple 's three daughters Leah Justine , Anna Winter , and Amelia Rose ; and a granddaughter .
